yemeni.name: Yemeni
yemeni.legend: Yemen is the only republic on the Arabian Peninsula. Although it was the site of several ancient civilizations, Yemen only exists in its current form since North Yemen annexed South Yemen in 1990.

cities.name: Sana'a', 'Adan, Al-Hudayda, Ibb, Hajja, Dhamar, Ta'izz, Al-Mukalla, 'Amran, Hawata, Sa'da, Al-Bayda, Al-Mahwit, Al-Dali', 'Ataq, Al-Jawf, Zinjibar, Rayma, Ma'rib, Al-Ghayda, Hadibu

yucatecan.name: Yucatecan
yucatecan.legend: _("Yucatán is a peninsula of Mexico, famous for its Maya heritage and its white beaches. Its name is often claimed to mean \"we don't understand you\" in Yucatec Maya. On two occasions in the 19th century Yucatán declared independence from Mexico. Currently it is divided into three states: Yucatán, Campeche and Quintana Roo.")

cities.name: Mérida

yugoslav.name: Yugoslav
yugoslav.legend: Yugoslavia was a state consisting of the Slavic nations of the western Balkans. It was a kingdom until 1941, when it was occupied by the Axis powers. After a national liberation war the communists threw out the occupants and continued to rule until the 1980s. The 1990s saw the bloody breakup of Yugoslavia into independent republics.

zambian.name: Zambian
zambian.legend: Zambia was inhabited by Bantu peoples when it was colonized by the British in the 19th century. Governed as Northern Rhodesia by the British, Zambia gained its independence in 1964.

cities.name: Lusaka, Ndola, Kitwe, Chipata, Kasama, Livingstone, Kabwe, Mansa, Mongu, Solwezi, Chingola, Mufulira, Luanshya, Kalulushi, Mazabuka, Chililabombwe, Mongu, Choma, Kapiri Mposhi, Kansanshi, Kafue, Monze, Sesheke, Mpika, Siavonga, Nchelenge, Petauke, Mbala, Samfya, Kawambwa, Mumbwa, Mwinilunga, Kaoma, Chinsali, Katete, Lundazi, Kalomo, Mkushi, Isoka, Maamba, Sinazongwe, Mwanzakombe, Chambishi

zanzibari.name: Zanzibari
zanzibari.legend: An archipelago off the coast of Eastern Africa, Zanzibar has been an international trading center since time immemorial. Zanzibari traders controlled much of the spice and slave trade in the western part of the Indian Ocean. Periods of relative independence and foreign control by Persians, Portuguese, Omanis and British followed each other. Occupied by the British in 1893, Zanzibar achieved independence in 1963. Shortly thereafter, the last sultan was overthrown and Zanzibar joined with Tanganyika to form the United Republic of Tanzania.

cities.name: Zanzibar, Chake Chake, Stone Town, Wete, Mwanyanya, Njuguni, Ngombeni, Konde, Bwegaza, Tumbe Mashariki, Kangani, Bweju, Shumba Mjini, Mahonda, Kiuyu, Maziwa Ng'ombe, Kijni, Chuini, Kivunge, Tumbe Magharibi, Mzuri, Chwaka, Micheweni, Kipanda Kiwani, Sizini, Ndijani, Jongowe, Kiungoni, Javini Ndagoni, Mpambani Msikitini, Mgazini Mkukiani, Michungwani, Kichachoni, Dunga Bweni, Kambini, Kangagani, Ole, Dole, Ukutini, Kiwenga, Chanjamjawiri

zapotec.name: Zapotec
zapotec.legend: The Zapotecs or Binnizá live in the Mexican state of Oaxaca. They formed one of the oldest and most resilient Mesoamerican civilizations. The most notable Zapotec center, Monte Albán, was built on a razed mountain top. Benito Juárez, Mexico's first indigenous president, was a Zapotec.

zhuang.name: Zhuang
zhuang.legend: The Zhuang people live in far southwestern China, an ancient border region that has long separated Sinitic civilization from the aboriginal peoples of Southeast Asia. Known for their unique irrigation and scenic terraced rice paddies, they were under pressure from various Chinese dynasties for most of the Ancient era. By the 10th century CE the Zhuang were under harsh rule by the Chinese Song dynasty. After a rebellion in 1052 led by folk-hero Nong Zhigao was crushed, many Zhuang migrated southward forming the basis of the Lao, Thai, and Shan nations. After the Han, the Zhuang are the most populous ethnic group of the People's Republic of China.

zimbabwean.name: Zimbabwean
zimbabwean.legend: Zimbabwe is a country in Southern Africa, named after the old Zimbabwe kingdom. It became a British colony called South Rhodesia in 1898. The white minority in South Rhodesia unilaterally declared independence in 1965. Prime Minister Ian Smith installed a racist regime which excluded blacks from power. A civil war forced Smith to end white minority rule in 1979. Since 1980 the country has been governed by Robert Mugabe, who has received an equally poor reputation internationally as the previous regime.

zulu.name: Zulu
zulu.legend: The Zulus are a warlike Bantu people who migrated from west-central Africa into southern Africa beginning in the early 1700s, conquering the native Khoisan peoples and clashing with European settlers.
